definition: to lose all interest in life (idiom)
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: His boredom with life may be due to the desuetude of his brain power.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活了无生趣，也许正是因为他没有用脑。

sentences.english: The self-enclosing killed all joys of my life.
sentences.chinese: 我的封闭，让生活了无生趣。

sentences.english: I'm sitting here in the boring room.
sentences.chinese: 我呆坐在这了无生趣的房间。
没有你的日子了无生趣。

sentences.english: He told me, “I have no life.
My daydreams aren't even dreaming. I feel bored, lost, uninterested in much of anything.
sentences.chinese: 甚至不再幻想，我不知所以，心烦意乱，了无生趣。

definition: every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
walking corpse (idiom)/zombie/person who lives only on the material level
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
